alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Murray (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 10:30PM CST until February 27 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CST FOR NORTHERN JOHNSTON...COAL...SOUTHERN SEMINOLE...PONTOTOC...CENTRAL ATOKA...SOUTHEASTERN MURRAY...SOUTH CENTRAL POTTAWATOMIE AND HUGHES COUNTIES... At 1029 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Sasakwa to 7 miles north of Tupelo to near Reagan, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Ada, Holdenville, Atoka, Coalgate, Konawa, Byng, Allen, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tupelo, Mill Creek, Francis, Calvin, Stuart, Bromide, Lamar, Sasakwa and Gerty. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
